title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in most parts of the island during the afternoon or night.

title: Fire breaks out at entertainment venue in Rajagiriya
byline: A sudden fire reportedly broke out at an entertainment venue in Rajagiriya early this morning (April 6), during an event being held at the venue.

title: PM Modi and President AKD to visit Anuradhapura today
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi is scheduled to visit Anuradhapura today (06), marking the final day of his three-day trip to Sri Lanka from April 4 to 6.

title: LG Polls: Ministry Secretaries & heads of state institutions summoned by EC
byline: All Secretaries of Ministries, heads of government institutions and statutory boards have been summoned for a special meeting at the Election Secretariat, Chairman of the National Election Commission R.M.A.L. Rathnayake said.

title: US starts collecting Trump’s new 10% tariff
byline: US customs agents began collecting President Donald Trump’s unilateral 10 per cent tariff on all imports from many countries on Saturday (Apr 5), with higher levies on goods from 57 larger trading partners due to start next week.

title: Indian Naval Ship ‘Sahyadri’ in Colombo
byline: The Indian Naval Ship (INS) Sahyadri has arrived in the country on a formal visit.

title: Sexual assault incident at Negombo Hospital: Special medical panel to examine victim
byline: Negombo Police has commenced an investigation based on a complaint received regarding the alleged serious sexual assault on a female patient at the Negombo General Hospital, according to the Police Headquarters.

title: Indian PM Narendra Modi arrives in Anuradhapura
byline: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi has reached Anuradhapura, a short while ago, marking the final day of his three-day trip to Sri Lanka.

title: Indian PM declares open upgraded Maho-Omanthai railway line and signaling system
byline: Visiting Prime Minister of India Narendra Modi and President Anura Kumara Dissanayake declared opened the Anuradhapura-Maho railway signaling system, a project supported by the Indian government, as well as the newly upgraded Maho-Omanthai railway line.

title: Britain says Israel’s detention of two UK MPs ‘unacceptable’
byline: Britain’s Foreign Secretary David Lammy said Saturday it was “unacceptable” and deeply concerning that Israel had detained two UK lawmakers and denied them entry.

title: Indian PM Narendra Modi concludes historic state visit to Sri Lanka
byline: Prime Minister of India Narendra Modi has left for India after concluding his historic two-day visit to Sri Lanka.

title: Proper waste management plan for all state institutions in 6 months
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, and Local Government has informed all government institutions to adopt sustainable waste management methods to enhance the efficiency of solid waste management within these institutions.

title: Sacred Tooth Relic exposition in Kandy: Mahanayaka Thero makes special request
byline: Devotees who are arriving in Kandy for the special exposition of the Sacred Tooth Relic must behave respectfully and in an orderly manner, Mahanayaka Thero of the Asgiriya chapter Most Venerable Warakagoda Sri Gnanarathana Thero said.

title: Sri Lanka releases 14 Indian fishermen during Modi’s visit
byline: In a significant gesture, Sri Lanka today released 14 Indian fishermen, to coincide with the visit of Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to the island.

title: Modi proposes to exhibit relics of Lord Buddha discovered in Gujarat
byline: Prime Minister of India Narendra Modi has proposed to exhibit sacred relics of the Lord Buddha that were discovered in the 1960s in Gujarat.

title: Govt. proposes to digitalize Sri Lanka’s entire healthcare system
byline: Steps will be taken to digitalize the entire government hospital system in the country, in a short period of time, aiming to provide efficient and high-quality healthcare services to the public, Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa, said.

title: High-level talks held with US to minimize impact of Trump’s tariffs - Govt
byline: High-level discussions have been held between the government and Washington to minimize the impact of the reciprocal tariffs announced by United States President Donald Trump will have on local businesses, Deputy Minister of Finance and Planning Harshana Sooriyapperuma has revealed.

title: Powerful storms hit the US, at least 16 killed
byline: Powerful storms that have battered the central and eastern United States have killed at least 16 people, officials said.
